result.execSummary:
The defendant Rhett L Walter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Straight Time. Sentence credit of 2 days were granted if imposed..
May transfer probation to Kenosha County.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Attend Anger Management and Domestic Violence counseling.

No Violent contact with Kelly S. AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. 
Court would consider early termination of probation after 6 months based on agent recommendation. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: To be completed as a condition of probation, as directed by agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rhett L Walter

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Rhett L Walter in court with attorney James E Goldmann.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty on Count #1 of the amended complaint.  Counts # 2 and 3 are dismissed and read in.  Attorney Goldmann requests that sentencing be scheduled in approximately two weeks. The Court schedules accordingly.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Rhett L Walter in court with attorney James E Goldmann.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The parties have reached an agreement and request the Court set the matter for a plea and sentencing at a future date.  The Court leaves the matter on for trial and schedules another jury status hearing for next week prior to the trial.  Jury status hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Response to State's Discovery Demand.
With witness list attached filed by State.

Defendant Rhett L Walter in court with attorney James E Goldmann.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has an offer but no discovery. State is tendering discovery today. Defense acknowledges receipt of discovery. Defense requests a jury status/jury trial date. Court grants request.  Jury status hearing scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to have no contact with Caroly B. and Nicole listed in the Criminal Complaint or their residences.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Kelly Seitz listed in the criminal complaint.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.    Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Rhett L Walter in court, in custody, with attorney James E Goldmann.   Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Kelly Sietz appearing.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 11:00 am.
